Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Utilization of computers and keyboards to acquire skills in MIDI sequencing, notation, CDs, and the Internet.

MUS3255 - German and English Lyric Dicti.name: MUS3255 - German and English Lyric Diction

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study and applications of the correct sung pronunciation of the German and English languages.

MUS3684H - How Music Affects Your Brain.name: MUS3684H - How Music Affects Your Brain

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Impact of sound and music on brain function including mood, emotion, pain, cognition, and memory using interdisciplinary approach, neuroscience and basic analysis of music structure.

MUS3254 - Italian and French Lyric Dicti.name: MUS3254 - Italian and French Lyric Diction

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study and applications of the correct sung pronunciation of the Italian and French languages.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Identification of opportunities in the entertainment marketplace, exploration of resources to explore those possibilities, and committing the necessary resources to achieve long-term gain.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Special topics of study and/or research as determined by student/faculty consultation.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Junior Level Applied Music and C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Public recital of 30 minutes to demonstrate performance skills.

MUS4674 - Health and Wellness for the Pe.name: MUS4674 - Health and Wellness for the Performing Artist

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Focus on performing artists' health and related topics.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Senior level applied music and C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Public recital of 45 minutes to demonstrate performance skills.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Music major, Music minor or Entertainment Management major, with a grade of "C"(2.0) or better in MUL 2010 or MUL 2720.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Today's music industry copyright, publishing, contracts and licensing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A series of special musical events required of music majors. Includes lectures and recitals by faculty, students, and guest artists.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The International Phonetic Alphabet and its application to English, French, German, and Italian music written for voice.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Selfdesigned project, completed under faculty supervision, that demonstrates ability to think critically and work independently while applying knowledge and skills from music and other subjects.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: Successful completion of two semesters of level I applied music, or C. I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Individual coaching and study of the art of music performance, including mock auditions and performances.
